00029 #define VS_BLT_USECOLORKEY                                                                0x000000002
00030 #define VS_BLT_USEDESTCOLORKEY                                                      0x000000200
00031 #define VS_BLT_FAST                                                                                         0x000000004
00032 #define VS_BLT_CLIPPED                                                                          0x000000008

00036 #define VS_BLT_COLORFILLRECT                                                        0x000000100

00039 //
00040 // Effects structure for specialized blitting
00041 //
00042 
00043 typedef struct 
00044 {
00045       COLORVAL ColorFill;           // Used for fill effect
00046       SGPRect      SrcRect;               // Given SRC subrect instead of srcregion
00047       SGPRect      FillRect;        // Given SRC subrect instead of srcregion
00048       UINT16       DestRegion;  // Given a DEST region for dest positions within the VO
00049 
00050 } blt_vs_fx;
00051 
00052 //
00053 // Video Surface Flags
00054 // Used to describe the memory usage of a video Surface
00055 //
00056 
00057 #define     VSURFACE_DEFAULT_MEM_USAGE          0x00000001              // Default mem usage is same as DD, try video and then try system. Will usually work
00058 #define     VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE                  0x00000002              // Will force surface into video memory and will fail if it can't
00059 #define     VSURFACE_SYSTEM_MEM_USAGE                 0x00000004              // Will force surface into system memory and will fail if it can't
00060 #define VSURFACE_RESERVED_SURFACE               0x00000100              // Reserved for special purposes, like a primary surface
00061 
00062 //
00063 // Video Surface creation flags
00064 // Used in the VSurface_DESC structure to describe creation flags
00065 //
00066 
00067 #define VSURFACE_CREATE_DEFAULT                   0x00000020            // Creates and empty Surface of given width, height and BPP
00068 #define VSURFACE_CREATE_FROMFILE                 0x00000040       // Creates a video Surface from a file ( using HIMAGE )
00069 
00070 //
00071 // The following structure is used to define a region of the video Surface
00072 // These regions are stored via a HLIST
00073 //
00074 
00075 typedef struct 
00076 {
00077       SGPRect                                               RegionCoords;                                         // Rectangle describing coordinates of region
00078       SGPPoint                                        Origin;                                                           // Origin used for hot spots, etc
00079       UINT8                                                 ubHitMask;                                            // Byte flags for hit detection
00080 
00081 } VSURFACE_REGION;
00082 
00083 //
00084 // This structure is a video Surface. Contains a HLIST of regions
00085 //
00086 
00087 typedef struct
00088 {
00089       UINT16                              usHeight;                                       // Height of Video Surface
00090       UINT16                              usWidth;                                        // Width of Video Surface
00091       UINT8                               ubBitDepth;                               // BPP ALWAYS 16!
00092       PTR                                       pSurfaceData;                             // A void pointer, but for this implementation, is really a lpDirectDrawSurface;
00093       PTR                                       pSurfaceData1;                      // Direct Draw One Interface
00094       PTR                                       pSavedSurfaceData1;           // A void pointer, but for this implementation, is really a lpDirectDrawSurface;
00095                                                                                                                         // pSavedSurfaceData is used to hold all video memory Surfaces so that they my be restored
00096       PTR                                       pSavedSurfaceData;            // A void pointer, but for this implementation, is really a lpDirectDrawSurface;
00097                                                                                                                         // pSavedSurfaceData is used to hold all video memory Surfaces so that they my be restored
00098       UINT32                              fFlags;                                               // Used to describe memory usage, etc
00099       PTR                                       pPalette;                                   // A void pointer, but for this implementation a DDPalette
00100       UINT16                              *p16BPPPalette;                     // A 16BPP palette used for 8->16 blits
00101       COLORVAL                      TransparentColor;             // Defaults to 0,0,0
00102       PTR                                       pClipper;                                       // A void pointer encapsolated as a clipper Surface
00103       HLIST                               RegionList;                               // A List of regions within the video Surface
00104             
00105 } SGPVSurface, *HVSURFACE;
00106 
00107 //
00108 // This structure describes the creation parameters for a Video Surface
00109 //
00110 
00111 typedef struct
00112 {
00113       UINT32                        fCreateFlags;                                   // Specifies creation flags like from file or not
00114       SGPFILENAME       ImageFile;                                      // Filename of image data to use
00115       UINT16                        usWidth;                                              // Width, ignored if given from file
00116       UINT16                        usHeight;                                             // Height, ignored if given from file
00117       UINT8                         ubBitDepth;                                     // BPP, ignored if given from file
00118 
00119 } VSURFACE_DESC;
